title: Xbox 主機根本完勝PS4同Switch d 垃圾

replies.msg:
我自細就係microsoft嘅粉絲， 細個由xbox 到xbox 360都有買。 當年xbox one係香港推出，足足遲咗ps4差唔多一年半，我都特登去遊戲展買day one edition嘅xbox one主機 ，依家諗番都覺得當年做嘅決定係正確

1. 返工啲工作效率高咗:
而家ps4啲毒撚，晚晚喺度屠龍屠到兩三點，我啲friend差唔多夜晚十一點喺group chat問要唔要組隊一齊屠龍之際，作為一個xbox的玩家已經一早十一點鐘上咗床瞓覺喇，知唔係想買隻xbox版嘅monster hunter難到登天， 又冇中文版又冇數位版下載 ，又冇得同啲friend一齊聯機玩 ，隻game仲要貴過ps4版本差唔多五六十蚊 ，不如早啲瞓第二朝早啲返工仲好

2. 呢兩年來儲咗唔少錢:
由xbox one推出以來咁耐我淨係買過3隻遊戲， 冇辦法啦， 你睇下舊年啲遊戲得獎名單，連一隻xbox獨佔嘅作品都冇， 你叫我邊買得落手，唔使買game呢兩年儲下儲下錢都已經夠我買咗層樓，而啲ps4毒撚到而家都仲未儲到首期

3. 同女朋友啲關係好咗:
記得以前喺xbox 360打halo3同halo4嘅時候，我女友喺我打機嗰陣一打畀我嘅話我一定會發好大脾氣，一句拯救緊世界，依家唔得閒，然後當堂cut咗佢線，跟住至少要嘈幾日；自從買咗xbox one之後，睇返Halo5都係2015年出，到而家都冇講幾時出續集；所以我同我女朋友啲關係好咗好多，仲有成日講電話，依家都差唔多就嚟結婚啦；唔似得啲ps4玩家為咗部機差啲同條女分手

4. 多咗時間去做運動同進修自己:
買xbox one之前，星期六日放假會打下機消磨時間做廢青，但自從買咗xbox one之後，差唔多放假都會落街跑步同埋去健身室做gym，又會花時間去進修同睇下書；冇辦法啦，你叫我對住每個月microsoft送嗰啲免費垃圾遊戲， 玩嗰時真係會懷疑人生點解呢啲遊戲會出到街；之後microsoft唔知痴左邊條線，將之後所有xbox遊戲都係pc度出埋，完全冇動力買xbox嘅遊戲

所以xbox玩家真係人生勝利組，買咗之後身心健康唔會沉迷遊戲，做人可以積極向上；我覺得如果啲細路沉迷電子遊戲，最好方法真係買部xbox one畀佢玩番兩三個鐘，之後直情會發奮讀書努力向上，因為冇諗過打機原來可以咁無聊；想睇下microsoft幾時再出返windows mobile，等啲人唔會沉迷手機

https://www.polygon.com/2017/12/2/16727700/playstation-plus-free-games-2017-value-analysis
In all, there were 74 games in PlayStation Plus’ free games offerings for 2017 (two were PlayStation VR bonuses, and counted among the averages and totals here), with an average Metacritic score of 71.3 and a combined retail price (currently) of $1287.25. The Metacritic average is nearly three full points worse than 2016 (74.1) and the total dollar value is more than $130 better ($1,150.79).

replies.msg:
“Sony’s PS3 is dying on the shelves.” That’s the first sentence in an article, titled “Sony’s PS3 A Sinking Ship: Sales Plummet,” over at CNNMoney.com. As PS3 owners ourselves, we’re more than a little worried – after all, we know how accurate the major news networks can be when it comes to our favorite hobby.
Kidding aside, the article does cite a thought-provoking statistic: while the Xbox 360 and Wii saw increased sales this November compared to last, PS3 sales actually dropped 19 percent. According to the author, three factors are contributing to the PS3’s iceberg-seeking trajectory:
It’s the most expensive console on the market.
No one cares about Blu-ray.
The PS3 doesn’t have any must-have exclusives.
What do you guys think? We offer up our opinions after the break.
Here’s our problem with those three reasons: only one of them is a fact. Yes, $400 is the least you can spend on a new PS3 (cheapassgamers might disagree). Compare that to $200 for an Xbox 360 and $250 for a Wii and you’ve got yourself an indisputable fact.
However, we’re going to take extreme issue with the author’s second and third points. Blu-ray is catching on big time, and I think the first-day sales numbers of The Dark Knight and Iron Man will back me up on that one. As for the third point, LittleBigPlanet, Valkyria Chronicles, and Resistance 2 say “Hi.” Heck, even IGN declared the PS3 the place to go for exclusives in 2008.
It’s obvious that a price cut would help the PS3’s competitive position, but it seems silly at this point to brand the black beauty a sinking ship. After all, Blu-ray is awesome, the exclusives are there (with more on the way), and we haven’t even begun to review emergency procedures (it’s men and old people first, right?).
